comments.commentBody:
There are so many serious problems in the world. North Korea, etc.

Rome burned while Nero fiddled. America might burn while Trump tweets.
Oh, it happened. But you are right, it was not Obama.

It's simple.  If providers of women's services want to get funding to provide these services, they should decouple from abortion.  People who believe in abortion are free to donate all they want to organizations set up to provide it.  Many Americans do not want to be part of a culture of death, where the unborn can be tossed in the trash or sold for research.

Where do you think childhood research comes from, not the lab rats.  Fetal tissue is the answer. Why do anti-choice people think "the decision" is all so easy to come to.  The GOP are the first to turn their backs on the same women whom they forced into the delivery room.   Sex Bad!!!
Go to your family doc or gyne for these services.  Why go to a baby death camp?

I would like to de-couple from for-profit prisons, the death penalty, subsidies to big oil and tobacco companies, private security firms terrorizing people in other countries in the name of the USA, and the new EPA that wants to increase pollution and therefore death via our air and water.
The issue of President Trump's mental competence now dominates all national matters.

Simple rule: When everyone has been fed, then we can complain about food. Until then, be grateful for what you have before you. If you are ordering a well-done steak at Olive Garden and smearing it with generic restaurant supply ketchup, there's about a billion people on this planet who would love to be at the table, even with fake decor and tepid reviews.

I love a good meal in a fine restaurant as much as anyone, but I'm also happy to chow down at any chain. I can see Mr. Bruni's point--that Mr. Trump's crude approach to eating (and talking, and groping, and mocking...) actually endears him to many of his supporters. We need to ignore the inconsequential and focus on the daily assaults on air, water, justice, equality, education, working people, sick people, and poor people (and all of their combinations) that we see flowing daily from the White House. Lack of culinary sophistication is the least of our problems.

Actually, culinary sophistication is one of our real problems. Many Americans are overweight because of their diets. I am horrified that Mr. Bruni disses President Obama about his snack of seven almonds. His athleticism and his cool were in part due to the excellence of his diet. Michelle Obama did the whole country a favor with her garden, carefully planned meals, and her athleticism. Although the Congress is trying to kill (or has killed) her work to have healthy school lunches, at least some children have profited by them and may grow up eating what will make the Affordable Care Act affordable.

You are what you eat!

I agree, although "sophistication" can also include proper selection and portion control--not just heavy meals in multiple courses.

My father gave me the best and simplest diet plan ever devised, and summarized in just a few words: "Eat what you like. Don't eat all of it."

It would make a best selling diet book, except all the inside pages would be blank because all of the necessary advice would be on the cover.

@Bus Bozo: I am pretty certain that The Olive Garden -- an ITALIAN restaurant -- does not serve steak.

And "generic restaurant supply ketchup" is nearly always Heinz -- the most popular and famous brand in the USA (and very good ketchup, IMHO).

The US President cannot be responsible to feed a billion people and every US President in history has eaten 3 meals a day, and during those 240 years, lots of people were hungry -- even starving. The President is not SUPERMAN and he cannot end world hunger.

If it weren't for the anti-choice groups and religious zealots keeping the issue of abortion in the forefront, who knows how many women (and men) might have had healthy happy lives, or still BE alive. I happen to be pro-choice, and have always maintained that Roe v. Wade never should have gone to the courts or government to begin with.  Nowhere in the Constitution does is say that the government, or men (informed or misinformed) should make health decisions for women. But then look how long it took for us to just get the right to vote. I have a daughter who is alive today because she went to a women's health clinic and caught cervical cancer before it had an opportunity to manifest itself fully in her body.  Because of that care, I now have a beautiful granddaughter and another one on the way. When we take religious ethos out of the equation, perhaps we can recognize that taking care of women's health is important.

The Constituion also does not say that the taxpayers must pay for a woman's or a man's health care choices. We should not make nor pay for a person's choices,  eg to be sexually active without being able to pay for that choice.
Abortion was legal in states containing half the population, including NY and California before Roe v Wade.
Yup - a tempest in a teapot. I actually don't care what he eats, but ketchup on steak is hardly far out there.  Glad to hear the 'W' likes PB & J - that makes me like him a tad bit more ;-)

Oy, the media is trying to rehabilitate W in the wake of Trump.

He's definitely preferable to Donald but...

Let's not forget Iraq.

It is really, really weird and unsettling to see the sudden fawning and admiration over GW Bush all of a sudden.

8 years ago, the liberals hated Bush about as much as anyone -- mocked him, reviled him -- and yet today, I've seen numerous articles about "gee, he's a pretty nice and compassionate man -- look at his paintings! -- and he eats PB&J just like regular folks!"

It just shows you, if you live long enough.... you get to see EVERYTHING.

In 10 years, will the same folks be rhapsodizing about how "Trump was really a pretty swell guy after all!"?????
Well said

Really? You never saw the news reports? You never read the interviews with Russians who were paid to be involve themselves in our election? That is a fact. What we don't know yet is only to what extent the Trump campaign was involved. There is some, but not enough evidence of that. Why do you think Der Fuhrer is sending out so many tweets now??

Sunshine is in over his head, doesn't understand how the US govt works, and maybe has something to hide.

Thinking of taking bets on where he's going to be taken into custody. I'm going with golf course...
Where?..how about when?

This stinks to high heaven of a cover-up and a preemptive attempt to label the perceived opposition with the kind of stuff that the Trump administration itself is trying to conceal.

With no evidence, President Trump and his administration have accused President Obama of "high crimes and misdemeanors" as specified in the Constitution.

White House Counsel McGahn is trying to get access to the order authorizing surveillance of the Trump and associates, which is irregular to say the least. Justice Department investigations and actions should be independent.

If such an order does exist, it was generated by the Justice Department as needed for an ongoing investigation, and approved by the standard court approval process.

The administration appears to be getting its news and marching orders from Breitbart which is now accusing Obama of orchestrating a "shadow coup" using "police state" tactics.

This morning President Trump himself accused Obama of being "Nixon/Watergate" and a "bad (or sick) guy."

Obama's gravitas, dignity and intelligence must be very hard for Trump and his supporters to swallow. What an example Obama set for all of us!

Now that all else is failing, Trump has gone back to the swamp where he first dug up the birther lie. Who better to demonize than the nation's first Black president?

It's not uncommon for a slightly-addled senior citizen--say, your nonagenarian great-aunt--to repost a less-than-credible Breitbart story that was in turn inspired by the rantings of conservative radio hosts. However, it is a problem when that addled individual is the President of the United States.

Trump is using an old schoolyard trick. Whenever he is called into question for bad behavior, he tries to defect from himself by pointing his finger at the other kid on the other side of the schoolyard and accusing him or her of doing the same thing or something worse. Just one of many examples during the campaign was when Trump's early morning tweets were causing Americans to wonder aloud if he was becoming unhinged, Trump announced to his supporters that Hillary was becoming unhinged.

What does senior citizenry have to do with not discerning real from fake? Many of us of a certain age are appalled at this behavior. We also remember a time when the MSM were much stronger and we were not subject to the instant click/bait of the Internet.

Now if Trump's behavior has worsened with age, and he does increasingly believe untruths and truly believes people are out to get him, these signs of possible cognitive decline should be heeded and evaluated.

I'm not interested in our obtaining an exact diagnosis, though. If he is sick, I have a bit of empathy for him. But empathy and believing he is capable of rationally governing are two different things entirely.
Easily!  They detest Obama.

Until Vice President Pence and his political allies at both the federal and state level are willing to put as much effort into promoting, supporting, and funding universal access to affordable birth control and preventable healthcare, affordable daycare, universal preschool, and quality public education for all children they only deserve to be called pro-birth not pro-life.

Interesting, too, that the number of abortions performed in America has decreased since ACA as more women have access to healthcare and contraception. This begs the question why would Republicans want to destroy a program that actually decreases the need for abortion?
Life ends at birth for these people and they care nothing about the living (particularly women).

"We'll go to war with NC during this term, that's plain to see."
I do not think war with North Carolina is likely.

What I find troubling about this article is the general lack of diplomatic ideas when all the military options are bad. Note the reference to the Korean War: the USA repeatedly threatened North Korea with nukes and thereby set this insanity in motion. In 2017, what does North Korea want? Do they see an ICBM nuke as their only path to stability? Do they wish to use it to further extort others? Is there a diplomatic solution?
trump's most urgent problem is managing his own freak show. North Korea is a distant second, but thanks, Barack, for the heads up.

Kim Jong-un? Surely, this cannot be the name of a person? The very (name) is unintelligible. Also, the photo of this purported cartoon looking creature resembles an asian version of the old Pillsbury doughboy ads. Regardless, he appears to be insane, a killer of his people. Can't we make this bizarre creature quietly disappear?
But the Cuba/Russia crisis was resolved because 2 SANE leaders were able to negotiate......Trump & Kim Jong-un.......not so good!

It's 70 years that you go on provoking North Corea.
Like you did to with Japan, killing 3000 people of yours in Pearl Harbor.
Sort of warmongers.
And now you dare to speak too.

Each and every day, a new item to worry about. Trump is completely unfit to be president. We all know this. The Republicans are willing to destroy our government to get their idealogical fantasies passed.

I'm not sure what purpose was served publishing this report. It would have some saving grace if we could say, "Look what we can do if we want to."  But then it reported nothing we did may have worked. So now N.K can say. "You did nothing. Ha. Ha. Ha."  The photo of  Kim Jong-un seems to be compatible  with him laughing at us. So is the point to tell us the Obama plan was totally worthless and now Trump's got to fix it, if it is fixable. At least he'll try to keep the jobs here before he sends them to another country.
After Trump comes up with a plan involving more than brain-dead bravado and empty bluster, we can talk about whether Democrats should support him on North Korea.
Yes "thank Obama" for keeping the NK at bay, not to mention all the other "threats" to the USA....diplomacy worked. Do you really believe Trump and his kin can do a better job?

How about, in exchange for this deal, we make Mexico a province of China and allow them to build naval bases in Lower California. About as realistic as this fairy tale.
If there were a way to de-nuclearize North Korea, someone would have achieved that in the last decade. There is no such way. The U.S. needs to recognize and openly acknowledge that Kim Jong-un run North Korea is a nuclear power and will remain a nuclear power, and begin negotiations over how it and the other nuclear powers ought to live with each other. The refusal to recognize this reality is stunning. There is no path to security through trying to disarm North Korea by threats or punishment.
